prompt: Macro photograph capturing the textured glass bottom of an antique, sea-glass green medicine bottle resting on a weathered wooden surface. Focused light illuminates the embossed two-digit number '42' and a maker's mark, casting subtle shadows. Shallow depth of field blurs the background, emphasizing the details crucial for identification. Professional, informative style. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: identify-old-bottles-numbers-bottom-image-1.png

prompt: A horizontal array of five diverse antique bottle bases lined up across a clean, neutral studio background. Each base shows different colors (amber, clear, cobalt blue), shapes, and distinct embossed numbers/symbols (e.g., '17', 'Owens Illinois diamond', 'AB Co'). Soft, even studio lighting highlights the variations in manufacturing marks for comparison. Photorealistic, catalog style. --ar 16:9
name: identify-old-bottles-numbers-bottom-image-2.png

prompt: Over-the-shoulder shot of a person wearing cotton gloves carefully holding an old, dusty brown glass bottle, tilting the base towards a brightly lit magnifying glass held in their other hand. The focus is sharp on the embossed numbers ('6 B') visible through the lens, while the person's hands and the background (a cluttered antique collector's desk) are slightly blurred. Warm, focused lighting enhances the sense of discovery and examination. --ar 16:9
name: identify-old-bottles-numbers-bottom-image-3.png

prompt: Wide landscape composition showing several old glass bottle bases partially unearthed from dark soil, simulating an archaeological dig site. Sunlight streams from the side, highlighting the dirt clinging to the glass and the faint, embossed numbers ('3', 'X') on a couple of the visible bases. Focus on the texture of aged glass and soil, conveying authenticity and the context of discovery. Photorealistic, natural lighting. --ar 16:9
name: identify-old-bottles-numbers-bottom-image-4.png

prompt: Split-screen composition for a 16:9 frame. Left side: A detailed close-up photo of an antique clear glass bottle base showing the embossed number '21' and a specific maker's mark. Right side: A slightly out-of-focus image of an open reference book or chart displaying information corresponding to that specific number and mark (e.g., 'Mold Number 21 - Illinois Glass Co. - Alton, IL - c. 1915'). Clean, educational aesthetic, balanced lighting. --ar 16:9
name: identify-old-bottles-numbers-bottom-image-5.png
